meanings.definition: A soldier who possesses exceptional physical and mental abilities.
meanings.sent1: The supersold led the team to victory with their unmatched strength and intelligence.
meanings.sent2: The government trained a group of supersolds to protect the country from threats.
meanings.sent3: The supersold tried to lift a tank with one hand, causing everyone to gasp in amazement.
meanings.sent4: She was like a supersold on the battlefield, moving swiftly and striking with precision.
meanings.sent5: The legend of the supersold who could outsmart any enemy spread far and wide.

meanings.definition: To enhance the abilities of a soldier through advanced training or technology.
meanings.sent1: The military decided to supersold their troops to prepare them for the upcoming mission.
meanings.sent2: They used cutting-edge technology to supersold the soldiers, making them stronger and faster.
meanings.sent3: The general joked that he wished he could supersold himself to keep up with the young recruits.
meanings.sent4: The new training program aimed to supersold the recruits into elite fighters in record time.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's invention promised to supersold any ordinary soldier into a superhuman warrior.
